Hi all, I'm relatively new to HubSpot and developing my css skills, but I've been asked to update the system pages for email (un)subscription and preferences. But now I'm stuck n 2 things
1. the styling of the button on the unsubscribe form keeps showing me HubSpot branding instead of colorscheme I'm using on other pages. Can anyone explain how I can change/overrule this?
2. On the styling of the preferences page is a very odd spacing (see image), but the only css on the subscription preferences is text align left. What should I do different?
Any support is much appreciated. Thanks!

1. use *!important* when you using css for color also make sure you have the class name same as you defined in CSS.
2. Add some *padding-top*  so that the button moves above and then give *margin-right* for the same button.

Hi guys! I got a request to implement a blog template which is flexible, so that the users can drag and drop modules themself in the blogpost. Is that possible? I noticed that flexible column is not available in blog templates?
Yes, flexible column is not added yet in Blog templates.
So its not possible to let users add the modules they need for a blog post? Or do you know a work around?
I normally add all the possible modules in template with show/hide feature.
yes, thats what I have done by now as well! I guess thats a fine work around :slightly_smiling_face: thanks!!
